creator: dave.kolaja

title: Thunderbird is empty
content:
A few weeks ago I started a project to transfer emails from a webmail service (a POP3 account) to local storage on my PC, using TB to move the emails and to be the 'container'. A trial download of around 90 emails appeared to be successful and the messages were moved into a number of TB local folders. Daily life then overtook the project. Now resuming, it's a bit of a shock to find TB almost completely empty: no emails, no folders, and no account for the webmail, no accounts at all. (The only thing there was a handful of collected addresses from a failed attempt some years ago to set TB up as an active client for a different webmail service.) I thought I exited TB after the trial download before manually deleting the messages on the webmail server but maybe I didn't — if this is significant. And I don't know what the TB settings for the webmail account were, which it set up automatically, as the account has now vanished. I should have checked at the time, I realise. Not much to go on but can anyone surmise what happened, what I did wrong? Should I assume that the emails are lost for good? I did not take a specific TB back up. There is nothing in the TB profile. File History was on an hourly schedule at the time but I am unclear what exactly it backs up, or how, and I can't see anything relevant there. And comments in the forum suggest you can't restore successfully from there anyway. And I'd be very grateful for any advice on how to do this properly so that the emails, etc., do not evaporate. Thunderbird v.102.10.0; Windows 10 (fully updated) Thanks, BJ

  • I have little technical prowess, so be gentle!
creator: BishopJ

title: Move Tabs to Unified Toolbar to reclaim vertical space
content:
Overall I am positive on the 115 release. However I have noticed that due to the new unified toolbar a lot of vertical space is lost if using multiple tabs. Since I have a small display vertical space is quite precious to me. So I was wondering if there is a way to either disable the unified toolbar (not preferred) or move the tabs into the unified toolbar (preferred)? And potentially even reduce the height of the unified toolbar beyond the compact option?

I assume it will have to be a modification via userChrome.css, but while I can maintain once I don't have the required knowledge to create my own.

Attached is a short comparison picture between 115 (left) and my current setup(right)

creator: supergarv

title: Thunderbird on Windows 10 - Changed location of Profile, profiles.ini & installs.ini now does not compact folders
content: 3 weeks ago my Thunderbird email client running on a Windows 10 laptop stated that it couldn't compact my email folders, because there was not enough space. It told me to delete emails for it to be able to compact. It had been set to advise me every time it had more than 10Mb to compact and up till then, it had always compacted successfully. So I deleted 100Mb of emails, yet it still told me that it needed me to delete more emails. The Profile folder was located in its own 10GB partition. So I checked the partition and found that it had less than 100MB of space left. So I copied the Profile folder into another 30GB partition and within Thunderbird, I changed the location of the four email local directories by typing the new location address in each of the Server Settings - Message Storage - Local Directory folder. I very soon noticed that I also had to change the address of the Profiles folder in the Profiles.ini and installs.ini folder. So I changed that manually. When I opened Thunderbird it appeared to open without any problems. My emails appear to be intact. I haven't noticed any missing or corrupted emails. The email structure e.g. sub folders, appear to be all there and correct, but it is not asking for the emails to be compacted. Under General Settings, the original setting is still set i.e. inform when more that 10MB and ask every time before compacting. The old Profiles address is not accessible to Thunderbird any more, although I can still access it and am keeping it as a backup. When I choose an email folder to compact, nothing happens. I have tried the Repair Folder dropdown for the main INBOX folder but nothing happened. I did notice that once all the Profile addresses were changed, Thunderbird automatically started to and completed re-indexing all the folders/files. What do I have to do to get Thunderbird to compact the email folders again, best regards Ian
creator: ian.mack

title: MS Outlook Authentication Method IN/OUT for Thunderbird Summer 2023
content:
Hi All,

Our team has been having a TERRIBLE time keeping up with all of the Authentication Method changes when setting up Outlook/Office365 Accounts in Thunderbird, specifically Incoming and outgoing security method.

It was previously just 'Normal Password', then changed to '0Auth2', but now NEITHER of those methods are available for us to designate..

Any ideas as to what the newest updated Outlook Method/Protocol is? Options are Kerberos/GSSAPI and NTLM, as 'Normal' and Encrypted are not pulling info.. Attached is a snap of what is available.

Thanks in Advance, Cool Kids :) -BG

title: Emails won't send
content:
Emails won't send. My provider is Eastlink.ca Many times when I try to send an email using Thunderbird, I get this msg. 

Sending of message failed.

An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: csp02.eastlink.ca Eastlink ELOB5014: Maximum failed authentication attempts from 96.30.131.2 has been exceeded.

It often happens the first time I try to send an email. Sometimes I can send it if I do a RESTART of the computer. Sometimes that doesn't work either. The only thing I can do is to copy the email into Eastlink Webmail, and then it always sends. However this is a very BIG nuisance!! Especially when I'm in a hurry. Thunderbird has been doing this for several weeks now. I don't know what to do. Thank you. Skippy Mardon in Canada

title: thunderbird + Exquilla
content:
ENGLISH Hello, I currently have two outlock (exchange) mail accounts configured with the Exquilla plugin. On 07/11/2023 something happened that the email appeared as follows:

a) The email accounts are not shown, which as I said there are two, nor are the typical "sent" folders, "spam", etc. Only the local folders appear, which are those where I store and classify the received and sent emails as backup.

In the "view" option is the folder panel toolbars option. If I click on any of the options in that menu, the email accounts appear, but the messages are still not being sent. When I open thunderbird again, the system reappears without showing the mail accounts.

b) emails cannot be sent, but they can be received.

c) It seems to me that the MC Afee antivirus program sent me an alert from thunderbird and sent some files to quarantine. This probably happened after a thunderbird update, so I've tried unquarantining the files, i.e. restoring them, but it still doesn't work.

I tried to reinstall thunderbird without uninstalling the one I had so I don't lose all my folder settings, but it still doesn't work.

Any ideas how to fix this without losing the many backup folders I have?

greetings and thanks

SPANISH Hola, actualmente tengo dos cuentas de correo de outlock (exchange) configuradas con el complemento Exquilla. El día 11/07/2023 algo sucedió que me apareció el correo de la siguiente forma:

a) No se muestran las cuentas de correo, que como dije son dos, ni tampoco las típicas carpetas "enviados", "correo no deseado", etc. sólo aparecen las carpetas locales que son aquellas donde yo almaceno y clasifico los correos recibidos y enviados como respaldo.

En la opción "ver" está la opción barras de herramientas del panel de carpetas. Si hago click en alguna de las opciones de ese menú, me aparecen las cuentas de correo, pero siguen sin enviarse los mensajes. Cuando vuelvo a abrir thunderbird, vuelve a aparecer el sistema sin mostrar las cuentas de correo.

b) no se pueden enviar correos, pero si se reciben .

c) Me parece que el programa antivirus MC Afee me envió un aviso de alerta proveniente de thunderbird y envió unos archivos a cuarentena. Esto probablemente sucedió después de una actualización de thunderbird, así que intenté sacar los archivos de cuarentena, o sea restaurarlos, pero sigue sin funcionar.

Intenté reinstalar el thunderbird sin desinstalar el que tenía para no perder toda la configuración de mis carpetas, pero sigue sin funcionar.

Alguna idea de cómo solucionar esto sin perder las muchas carpetas de respaldo que tengo?

saludos y gracias
creator: coolblue7003

title: Searching in TB
content: I am not sure if I am doing something wrong or if it's just a bug in Thunderbird, but when I go to search for things - for example, I know there is an email with "$17.99" quoted somewhere in the email. So I type 17.99 up in the search box, and no results are found. I, however, change my search to "Paypal" and look for that term and that will bring up several emails containing "Paypal" and within those emails I will see the email with the "17.99" quoted within it. title: Select All button
content:
I have asked this same question a couple three years ago. All I got back then was push back.

So, if I may, allow me to ask again....

There used to be a Select All button available in the add-ons. But that option is no longer available.

I had presented use cases for the simple addition of a Select All button in the Customize area.

Yet all i got in response was comments like, ~if that's what you want, write your own button.~

Is this community that acrid?

So i will ask again, there seems to have been a major UI overhaul in Thunderbird of late.

And a Select All button was left out.

Should i go explore other email options?

I mean really, what is so difficult about implementing such a basic UI button in the UI?


Really....

title: Thunderbird 102 sporadically high processor use, consumes tons of power on idle.  Calendar activity in CalDavSession.jsm
content:
Thunderbird 115.0 (though also happened on 102), M2 macbook pro; OS up to date.

On AC & battery, thunderbird uses up huge amounts of power sporadically in its background activity, taking up ~50-80% of processor power & hundreds of gb virtual memory (see activity monitor screenshot attached). Computer gets pretty hot to touch with thunderbird on, which I don't see with other apps. Troubleshooting info below.

This has been happening for several months now, since I switched to thunderbird & was hoping it would resolve at 115. I can't find any correlation with other usage patterns of the computer (ie I dont think it's correlated with idle usage, but not willing to stage reputation on that).

Thanks so much for any help!

title: TB 115.0 The quickfilter is broken / losing focus when using shortcut keys

For the release version of TB 115.0

The quickfilter is broken is a particular manner:
